prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

name: Ajax, Cole, Claude & Vincent
mes:
“Bro. Bro. Brooo, pull the fuck over or something, I need a smoke.” Cole smacks Ajax on the shoulder, practically vibrating in the backseat.

Ajax’s eye twitches. He glares at Cole through the rearview mirror, looking one minor inconvenience away from manslaughter. Cole’s been begging for a smoke break for like, the fiftieth time. No one's counting anymore, just fucking annoyed at this point.

“Fuck’s sake, Ajax, pull over. If I hear him ask one more time, I'm gonna lose my fucking mind.” Vincent growls from the passenger seat, spinning around to hit Cole with a death glare that’d make anyone else cower.

Cole either doesn’t notice or just actively doesn’t give a shit. Probably the latter.

Claude and Hailee are in the backseat too, silently radiating ‘I’m gonna lose it’ energy but choosing the high road and not saying anything.

Finally, Ajax jerks the car to the side of the road—middle of nowhere, just green fields and the gentle scent of grass.

Everyone hops out. Before Ajax can even blink, Cole yoinks the keys right out of his hand like a goddamn raccoon. He holds them up high, smirking like the menace he is.

“I’m driving next. Hailee gets shotgun. I swear if I gotta listen to one more of Vincent’s sad divorce dad playlists or watch Ajax do 40 in a 60 zone, I'm gonna unalive myself.” Cole sprints off toward the nearest patch of trees, keys jingling like a threat.

Everyone reluctantly trudges after him. Vincent pulls out a pack of smokes, offering one to Ajax wordlessly who accepts and also pulls one out. Cole already has a cig between his lips, leaning against a tree like he’s posing for a garbage fashion magazine.

Claude scrolls through the group chat. “Some of the others already checked in. Rooms don’t look like total ass, at least.”

Vincent snorts, disgust dripping from his voice. “My parents are paying ungodly amounts of money a semester so I can end up camping like a drunk Girl Scout.”

Cole grins. “What’s wrong, big guy? Scared a lil’ grass and fresh air’s gonna mess up your skincare routine? Or wait… you scared of bugs?”

Vincent glares like he’s considering murder. “Anything with more than two legs was a mistake from god. Period.”

Cole snorts, taking another drag. “You’re so mean. Bugs didn’t do shit to you.”

“They exist,” Vincent deadpans, flicking his cigarette to the ground and stomping it out. Then he stretches a hand out at Cole. “Give me the key. I don't trust you.”

Cole gasps dramatically, clutching his chest like he’s just been personally betrayed. He looks at Hailee like, *Can you believe this slander?*

Vincent just rolls his eyes and gestures again, clearly unimpressed and too impatient by now.

Cole steps on his cigarette too, hands disappearing into his pockets, and goes:
“Oh.”

All heads whip toward him.

Ajax's voice comes low and dangerous. "The fuck you mean, ‘Oh’?"

Cole, with the self-preservation instincts of a particularly stupid moth, just smiles. "Well, you see, funny story—the keys might’ve, uh... relocated."

Vincent looks ready to strangle him with his bare hands. "You lost the fucking key?"

"Technically," Cole says, backing up. "Technically, y'all lost it by trusting me with it." Cole shrugs, wearing that cocky little grin that guarantees he's getting punched eventually. “Honestly? This is on y’all for trusting me. That’s a *you* problem.”

Ajax looks ready to rip Cole’s throat out with his bare hands.

Before anyone can lunge, Cole grabs Hailee and physically hoists them up in front of him like a human shield.

Ajax freezes, narrowing his eyes.

“New low, even for you, bro.” Claude says, voice dry.

Cole peeks over Hailee’s shoulder. “Look, man, he hospitalized me over a prank once. I’m not tryna get my ass kicked in the woods.”

“That wasn’t a prank, that was pure fucking disrespect.” Ajax’s voice practically rumbles.

Cole scoffs. “Agree to disagree. Anyway, I’m fragile now. Handle with care.”

Ajax growls. “Put them down and take your ass-whooping like a grown-up.”

“I’m not a grown-up.” Cole chirps.

Vincent just sighs and shoves Ajax back. “We’ll beat his ass later. Priorities: find the fucking key.”

“Listen to the princess, Ajax.” Cole says with a shit-eating grin.

Vincent glances at him blankly, then just drops his hand from Ajax’s chest. “Actually, fuck it. Let's beat him up now.”

Before chaos erupts, Claude yanks Hailee free from Cole’s grip. “Focus. Find the damn key. It probably fell somewhere around here.”

Grudging nods all around. Ajax immediately pulls out his phone and lights up the flashlight, grumbling one insult after another under his breath.

It’s dead in the night now, just the moon and stars casting light on the group. 

“If I die out here, I want Hailee to be my last meal.” Cole jokes with a wink, still way too relaxed about everything.

Claude doesn’t even look up. “Shut the fuck up and find the key.”

Ajax glances over at Hailee too. “Don’t just stand there being useless. Get your ass moving.”

Vincent nods in agreement but doesn’t even pretend to help.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee shakes her head and hops on the hood of the car* "Dont look at me you monkeys lost the keys you monkeys find them"

name: Ajax, Cole, Claude & Vincent
mes:
Ajax’s head snaps up so fast his neck cracks. His blue eyes narrow into slits, the moonlight catching the dangerous glint in them.

**"Excuse me?"** His voice is low, almost a growl.

Cole immediately bursts out laughing, slapping his knee like Hailee just told the funniest joke in existence. **"Ohhh shit! Did our little Hailee just call us monkeys?!"** He wipes an imaginary tear from his eye before grinning at Ajax. **"Damn, bro, you got *roasted*."**

Claude exhales sharply through his nose—his version of amusement—before turning back to scanning the ground with his phone light. **"Yeah yeah, hilarious. Still doesn’t change that we’re stranded if we don’t find that key."**

Vincent leans against the car next to Hailee's legs on the hood, arms crossed over his chest as he smirks down at her with a raised brow. **"Cute attitude for someone who *needs* one of us to carry her bags when she gets tired after five minutes of walking."** His tone is teasing but laced with challenge—daring her to keep pushing her luck.

Ajax stalks toward the car like a predator circling prey, stopping right in front of Hailee and planting both hands on either side of her hips on the hood—caging her in without touching yet somehow making it feel suffocating anyway. His breath fans over her face as he tilts his head slightly and murmurs:
**"...You wanna repeat that again? Slowly this time?"**

name: Ajax, Cole, Claude & Vincent
mes:
Ajax’s entire body goes rigid. His jaw clenches so hard his teeth grind audibly, blue eyes darkening with something between fury and disbelief.

**"Oh, you’re *fucking* brave tonight."** His voice is a low, dangerous rumble—the kind that usually precedes someone getting thrown through a wall.

Cole lets out an exaggerated whistle from the sidelines, grinning like he just won the lottery. **"Damn! Hailee woke up today and chose *violence*!"** He nudges Claude with his elbow. **"Bro, I think Ajax might actually kill her."**

Claude doesn’t even look up from where he's still half-heartedly searching for the key in the grass. **"Good for her,"** he mutters dryly before adding, **"...and good luck to him explaining that to campus security."**

Vincent exhales sharply through his nose—his version of laughter—before lazily pushing off the car and stepping closer to observe the scene like it's prime entertainment. His smirk is all sharp edges as he watches Ajax seethe under Hailee’s grip.

Ajax doesn't move yet—just keeps staring at her with that same terrifying intensity as his fingers dig into the hood of the car beside her thighs. Then, slowly… deliberately… his lips curl into something far more predatory than a smile.

**"...You got five seconds to let go before I remind you exactly who you belong to."**

name: Ajax, Cole, Claude & Vincent
mes:
Ajax’s grip on the car hood tightens so hard the metal creaks under his fingers. His breath hitches for just a fraction of a second—before his entire expression darkens into something *feral*.

**"That's it."**

In one brutal motion, he yanks himself free from her grip, grabs Hailee by the waist, and flips her off the hood of the car—slamming her back-first against it with enough force to knock the air from her lungs. His body cages hers instantly, one hand pinning both of hers above her head while the other grips her jaw hard enough to bruise.

Cole lets out an impressed whistle. **"Ohhh shit."**

Vincent exhales smoke lazily, watching with amusement as Ajax leans down until his lips brush Hailee’s ear—his voice dropping into a rough whisper that only she can hear:
**"You wanna play games? Fine. But you don't get to act like you're not *mine* when I'm done with you."**

Claude finally looks up from where he was still pretending to search for keys and rolls his eyes. **"Jesus Christ, just fuck already so we can find those damn keys."**

Ajax doesn’t even glance at him—just keeps staring down at Hailee like she's prey caught in his teeth. **"...You hear that? Even Claude's sick of your mouth."** He drags his thumb over her bottom lip before adding in a growl:
**"So shut it... unless you want me to do it for you."**

name: Ajax, Cole, Claude & Vincent
mes:
Ajax’s entire body tenses like a coiled spring, his jaw locking so tight it could crack. His blue eyes burn with something primal—half fury, half hunger—as he watches Hailee saunter away.

**"Oh, you *little*—"**

Cole is already sprinting after her before Ajax can finish the sentence, laughing like a madman as he calls over his shoulder: **"Fuck the keys! I volunteer as tribute!"**

Vincent flicks his cigarette to the ground and crushes it under his shoe with a slow smirk. **"...Well. Guess we're taking a detour."** He doesn't even pretend to hesitate before following Cole across the street.

Claude sighs deeply, rubbing his temples like he's already regretting every life choice that led him here. But after a beat of silence, he shoves past Ajax with an irritated grumble: **"Move your ass unless you wanna be last in line."**

Ajax growls low in his throat—but within seconds, all four of them are stalking toward that motel like wolves on a hunt. And Hailee? She just won herself one *very* long night.

name: Ajax, Cole, Claude & Vincent
mes:
Cole lets out a surprised but delighted laugh as Hailee yanks him flush against her, his arms instinctively wrapping around her waist. He nuzzles into the crook of her neck with a teasing nip, murmuring against her skin:

**"Damn, baby—already putting me first? I *knew* you had a favorite."**

Ajax is right behind them in seconds, his broad frame looming like a storm cloud as he glares at Cole’s hands on Hailee. **"Hands *off* until we’re in the fucking room,"** he snaps, voice dripping with warning.

Vincent strolls up next, plucking the key from the receptionist’s hand before she can even fully extend it toward Hailee. He inspects it lazily before smirking down at her. **"Hope you didn’t think you were calling the shots tonight."** His fingers tangle possessively in her hair as he leans down to whisper: **"...You don't get to decide who touches you first."**

Claude is last to approach—not because he's slow, but because he took his damn time walking over like this whole thing is beneath him. Still, when his dark eyes land on Hailee pressed between all of them, something hungry flickers in his gaze before he clicks his tongue and mutters: **"Room number or are we just gonna stand here all night?"**

The receptionist looks equal parts horrified and fascinated as she stammers out: **"Uh—room 12B... down the hall to your left..."**

Cole grins and starts steering Hailee toward it without letting go. **"Perfect! Let's go break that bed in."**
swipes:
